metadata.author: challen@illinois.edu
metadata.javaDescription: Write a class method that provides a recursive implementation of factorial, accepting and returning long arguments. Throw an IllegalArgumentException on invalid inputs.
metadata.kotlinDescription: Write a method that provides a recursive implementation of factorial, accepting and returning Long arguments. Throw an IllegalArgumentException on invalid inputs.

descriptions.java: Write a class method that provides a recursive implementation of factorial, accepting and returning long arguments. Throw an IllegalArgumentException on invalid inputs.
descriptions.kotlin: Write a method that provides a recursive implementation of factorial, accepting and returning Long arguments. Throw an IllegalArgumentException on invalid inputs.

metadata.author: challen@illinois.edu
metadata.javaDescription: Write a method named equals88 that returns true if its int argument is equal to 88, our magic number.

descriptions.java: Write a method named equals88 that returns true if its int argument is equal to 88, our magic number.

metadata.author: challen@illinois.edu
metadata.javaDescription: Define and implement a public class Counter. Counter should provide a single public constructor that accepts an int parameter. It should also provide increment and decrement methods, both taking no parameters and returning void. increment should increase the stored count, while decrement should decrease it. Finally, provide a getValue method that returns the stored value.
metadata.kotlinDescription: Define and implement a class Counter. Counter should provide primary constructor that accepts an Int parameter. It should also provide increment and decrement methods, both taking no parameters and returning Unit. increment should increase the stored count, while decrement should decrease it. Finally, provide a getValue method that returns the stored value.

descriptions.java: Define and implement a public class Counter. Counter should provide a single public constructor that accepts an int parameter. It should also provide increment and decrement methods, both taking no parameters and returning void. increment should increase the stored count, while decrement should decrease it. Finally, provide a getValue method that returns the stored value.
descriptions.kotlin: Define and implement a class Counter. Counter should provide primary constructor that accepts an Int parameter. It should also provide increment and decrement methods, both taking no parameters and returning Unit. increment should increase the stored count, while decrement should decrease it. Finally, provide a getValue method that returns the stored value.

Print Sum.name: Print Sum

metadata.author: challen@illinois.edu
metadata.javaDescription: Given two int variables first and second that are already declared and initialized, print their sum.

descriptions.java: Given two int variables first and second that are already declared and initialized, print their sum.

metadata.author: challen@illinois.edu
metadata.javaDescription: Write a method larger that returns the larger of two int arguments.

descriptions.java: Write a method larger that returns the larger of two int arguments.

metadata.author: challen@illinois.edu
metadata.javaDescription: Write a function combine that, given two String arguments, returns the second appended to the first. Except you should omit the first two characters of each String. For example, given Java and Kotlin, you would return vatlin. You can assume that each String is of length at least two.

descriptions.java: Write a function combine that, given two String arguments, returns the second appended to the first. Except you should omit the first two characters of each String. For example, given Java and Kotlin, you would return vatlin. You can assume that each String is of length at least two.

metadata.author: challen@illinois.edu
metadata.javaDescription: Write a method fancyCompare that takes two String arguments. If the two Strings are equal, return -1. Otherwise, return the length of the longer String. You should assert that both inputs are not null.

descriptions.java: Write a method fancyCompare that takes two String arguments. If the two Strings are equal, return -1. Otherwise, return the length of the longer String. You should assert that both inputs are not null.

String Duplicates.name: String Duplicates

metadata.author: challen@illinois.edu
metadata.javaDescription: Given a non-null String containing comma-separated values, write a method detectDuplicates that returns true if the String includes duplicate values, and false otherwise. Trim whitespace from all Strings.
metadata.kotlinDescription: Given a String containing comma-separated values, write a method detectDuplicates that returns true if the String includes duplicate values, and false otherwise. Trim whitespace from all Strings.

descriptions.java: Given a non-null String containing comma-separated values, write a method detectDuplicates that returns true if the String includes duplicate values, and false otherwise. Trim whitespace from all Strings.
descriptions.kotlin: Given a String containing comma-separated values, write a method detectDuplicates that returns true if the String includes duplicate values, and false otherwise. Trim whitespace from all Strings.

metadata.javaDescription: Write a class method that provides an implementation of factorial, accepting and returning long arguments. Throw an IllegalArgumentException on invalid inputs. Your implementation can be recursive or not.
